reviews.sentence: Bright and cheery. I had the VIP hotel experience. The staff were so helpful and the room was beautiful. I watched the sunset from my balcony. Everyone on staff were very eager to ensure I was comfortable. I was even looking for a local ice cream shop and the front desk gave me a few ideas and did not push room serviceThe downfall is that with the VIP reservation I was given the free breakfast buffet. Super right. When I went to use the coupon the first day for breakfast the waiter was excellent and made sure my coffee was full and I have everything I needed. The second day I had another waiter that asked if I had a coupon for the breakfast. My husband said we did and all of the sudden the waiter played the disappearing act. We did not get our coffee for a long time and I had to ask another server for it and cream. He was not even around for a refill. I suppose that he thought he would not get a tip because we did not pay for the breakfast. When he gave us the receipt and indicated to put our room number down he was very clear on where we would put how much we wanted to tip him. For a waiter that did not help at all he was undeserving of a tip however my husband did insist on leaving him a couple of bucks. I had come back and stay again as I am frequently in the area but I will not be eating there. Most of the staff the bright and airy atrium and facilities the sunset from my balcony. Go to the airport Fashion Island UCI and the beach. One staff member that could use some retraining.
Staff at the restaurant in the lobby were absolutely fantastic. The hotel was nice but room was a little cramped and I found it odd kids shows had to be paid for. Over all a nice stay.

A commuter or short stay hotel. Traveling 6 months of the year with work I prefer to stay well away from an airport or area close to an airport. My first stay I was given a room on runway airport side of hotel. During the 2 day stay I would of managed no more than 6 hours sleep total. No available rooms on other side of hotel. Across the road from hotel is a car rental storage area where transporters regularly on and off load cars. Hotel service and staff is generally pretty good and although I have never eaten in restaurant I understand that the food is quite good. A grab and go snack coffee and fruit service is available for early starters. This is a commuter hotel and there is the odd conference or two. It can get noisy within hotel as noise travels up from lobby to rooms.

The pool was nice and the lounge chairs comfy but the Jacuzi was not functioning. The location right by the airport was loud and even with soundproofing one could still hear the planes. Also the water pressure in the shower was spotty.

Tired old hotel. My wife son and I stayed overnight at the Radison Hotel Newport Beach. First of all the location is barely Newport Beach as it is very close to the John Wayne Airport and NOT near what most people would consider Newport Beach. You would definitely need a car if you wanted to go to anyplace in Newport Beach or Orange County. The hotel itself looks quite dated and there was even a picture in the lobby of planned improvements. The front desk people were quite friendly and efficient. While we used a free night certificate we were acknowledged as Club Carlson elite members. However we received no benefits just as a side note at both IHG and Hilton properties we routinely are offered free breakfastThe room itself was okay. It did have a microwave refrigerator and hdtv. Curiously the HDTV offered only analog stations so it was like watching a tv from the 1990s. The beds were fine. The room needed painting the bathroom door was chipping at the bottom the tub looked like it had been patched and the bathtub and bathroom faucet plugs looked like 25 year old originals. We did appreciate the free parking and the free wifi was adequate. Overall if I needed a flight from SNA I would accept this hotel as functional. For all other stays I am sure you can do better.

Over priced for the room but overall not bad. I live 10 miles towards the beach but needed to list get some things done for the weekend in solitude. From desk night staff Daniel was wonderful and accommodating and the rest of staff always pleasant. The room was very clean. My main positive experience was the heated pool and hot tub especially during sow season and it being empty. I do think however closing it down at 10 pm was too early.
Good. The bed was very comfortable. The staff was very courteous. The television was outdated and had a very grainy picture. The shower was almost impossible to manipulate to regulate the water temp.

Terrible stay. The hotel smells awful like a mixture of bleach and urine. It smelled so bad that I left the balcony door open for most of my stay even though the airport noise was horrible. The towels in my room were stained. Everything is old. Do not stay here.
We really enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this hotel. The facilities were perfect. Staff very accommodating. Nice to have drinking water bottles provided for free in our room.

Fantastic like new nice staff excellent facilities massive TV From Australia you never know what you ’re going to get until you arrive this place is amazing for the money. Like new huge TV in rooms and just fantastic. Highly recommended. Kids loved watched the planes taking off. Noise all ok. It ’s a tad far depending what you want to be doing. But if you want to stay in this area then this is perfect.
Since remodel beautiful modern room with big screen lg tv with built in chrome cast beautiful bath room free wifi. Although wifi speed is a bit slow. But nice hotel.

Was a great place after a long flight and the 12 pm check out time gave me ample time to wake up. This Hyat was really beautifully redesigned with a lot of small touches in the room book reading light stocked Keurig with bedtime tea and coffee sound panel behind the TV and even a digital clock inside the mirror in the bathroom to keep track of getting ready timeLocation had no real attraction other that it was in a very convenient area.

Nice place smaller room no bathtub. Summary. An upscale hotel with comfy but small rooms and pretty good amenities. Pluses. The hotel and the room are both very cleanice staff nice not overall crowded bar and restaurantquietdecent fitness centerclean pool and spaclose to airport but also good central OC location 5 minutes to UCI 10 minutes to beach 20 30 minutes to Disneyfre parkingeasy to use business centerVery comfy bed restaurants within walking distanceNegativesrom is on the smaller sidethere is a walk in shower but no bath I guess a lot of people do not care but I like to take baths. Also the shower is kind of hard to usemost hotels of this scale have heat air where you can adjust to exact temp. This room has an old fashioned heath air system and it took a while to heat the room. I know nice hotels like this typically do not have microwaves and this one did not either but they would be nice.

Nice place smaller room no bathtub. Summary. An upscale hotel with comfy but small rooms and pretty good amenities. Pluses. The hotel and the room are both very cleanice staff nice not overall crowded bar and restaurantquietdecent fitness centerclean pool and spaclose to airport but also good central OC location 5 minutes to UCI 10 minutes to beach 20 30 minutes to Disneyfre parkingeasy to use business centerVery comfy bed restaurants within walking distanceNegativesrom is on the smaller sidethere is a walk in shower but no bath I guess a lot of people do not care but I like to take baths. Also the shower is kind of hard to usemost hotels of this scale have heat air where you can adjust to exact temp. This room has an old fashioned heath air system and it took a while to heat the room. I know nice hotels like this typically do not have microwaves and this one did not either but they would be nice.
Great comfortable bed and pilowsClean and beautiful bathroom little balcony fantastic.

Excellent Location New Clean Free Parking. It was such a delight to walk into this hotel and i loved my room. I ’m always staying in high end 5star hotels so was n’t sure what to expect. I only stayed one night but def would stay here again. The location is great close to airport and New Port Beach and Costa Mesa. My room was clean fresh and felt new as it was recently remodeled. The bed was comfy and the TV was so big. I actually wish I had more time to sleep and watch TV. It had a Keurig maker with Starbucks coffee cups and tea cups. The shower was amazing too. And felt like I had a lot of room. Had a living area with a floor mirror and coach. And ca n’t beat the free parking. Lots of parking space and no fee.

it is a nice hotel clean spacious never feels overcrowded in the lobby or the parking. The rooms are nice and just enough space. I shared a room with my mom and my 9 month old daughter and we were just fine. They cleaned the room after we had been here the first night while we were out for the day and did a great job. it was like coming back to a whole new room all over again. they did not scramble our stuff around like ahat happens sometimes when room service gets in your room while you are gone. The bathrooms are really nice and the balcony is convenient to have as an option for fresh air if you like to open a door or a window to the outside. No complaints. Its everything I would expect for a room in a hotel for this price and location.

Very nice property. I stayed here recently for a single night at the end of a business trip that I extended to see family. I ended up staying at 3 separate hotels and this was the best room and food of the three. One of the others was a resort and had nice grounds but the room itself there was just OK. Would definitely stay here again.
